homepageTopArticles.title: Recap: The biggest retail mergers and acquisitions of 2025
homepageTopArticles.snippet:
Some of the largest online retailers, fulfillment companies and technology providers made mergers and acquisitions in 2025, reshuffling some major retail industry portfolios for 2026. And while some of these mergers and acquisitions in 2025 were the result of bankruptcy filings (like Joann’s), many were expansion plays. They featured a retailer that sold part of […]
The post Recap: The biggest retail mergers and acquisitions of 2025 appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.
homepageTopArticles.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: In 2025, major players in the retail industry engaged in mergers and acquisitions to reshape their portfolios for 2026, with some driven by bankruptcy filings and others by expansion strategies. homepageTopArticles.title: Ecommerce faces a structural reckoning in 2026
homepageTopArticles.snippet:
Ecommerce is entering 2026 in what executives describe as a structural reset, driven by the rise of artificial intelligence (AI)-powered shopping, autonomous network operations and tariff changes that are reshaping supply chains. Instead of incremental digital upgrades, companies are preparing for a year in which competitiveness hinges on the speed of operational change, the quality […]
The post Ecommerce faces a structural reckoning in 2026 appeared first on Digital Commerce 360.
homepageTopArticles.aiSummary: AI-generated summary: Ecommerce is undergoing a structural reset in 2026 due to AI-powered shopping, autonomous network operations, and tariff changes reshaping supply chains, leading companies to focus on operational agility for competitiveness.
homepageTopArticles.rerankWhy: Discusses structural changes in ecommerce for 2026

homepageTopArticles.title: Cartier UK sales top £250 million for the first time
homepageTopArticles.snippet:
Cartier has grown at twice the pace of its parent company, Richemont, in the UK, the company’s latest published accounts show. Sales in the UK rose by 11% to £251 million in the financial year that ended in March 2025. Operating profit increased by 25% to £15 million. Richemont, excluding Cartier, reports separately. Its UK […]
The post Cartier UK sales top £250 million for the first time appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
homepageTopArticles.aiSummary: AI-Generated Summary: Cartier's UK sales reached over £250 million for the first time, growing at twice the pace of its parent company Richemont. Sales rose by 11% to £251 million in the financial year ending March 2025, with operating profit increasing by 25% to £15 million.
homepageTopArticles.rerankWhy: Highlights significant sales growth in luxury retail

homepageTopArticles.title: Pragnell sales top £100 million for first time
homepageTopArticles.snippet:
Pragnell delivered record sales of £100.5 million in its 2024-25 financial year but rising costs, including investment in expanding its retail network, continued to weigh on operating profit. While revenue rose by 6% for the 12 months to May 2025, operating profit declined by 11% to £8 million and is down from a peak of […]
The post Pragnell sales top £100 million for first time appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
homepageTopArticles.aiSummary:
AI-generated summary:
Pragnell achieved record sales of £100.5 million in the 2024-25 financial year, with a 6% revenue increase, but operating profit declined by 11% to £8 million due to rising costs and investments in expanding its retail network.

prompt:
Photograph a luxury jewelry boutique in London. Capture a luxury retail manager examining a newly acquired luxury watch with a digital tablet (screen turned away) nearby, while an affluent customer browses the jewelry display case. Use natural lighting and a medium-depth of field to emphasize realism, with reflections on glass and slight imperfections in surfaces. Avoid text, signage, or visible screens. Capture a candid, mid-action moment that feels human and editorial, steering clear of stock photo aesthetics.

CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS (must be strictly avoided):
- text, letters, numbers, signage, labels, screens, UI, dashboards, holograms, floating icons, logos, brands, watermarks, cartoon, illustration, CGI, 3D render, anime

COMPOSITION FOR WIDE HERO BANNER (CRITICAL):
- Wide, horizontally expansive banner format (target 3:1 or wider aspect ratio)
- Vertically minimal height - all important visual elements must be placed in the central horizontal band
- Safe margins at top and bottom - no critical content near vertical edges
- Composition must work when displayed in a wide, shallow container
- Avoid vertical stacking, tall elements, or content that extends to top/bottom edges
